item.title: Scots to need vaccine passports for large events
item.description: People who have not been fully vaccinated will not be able to attend many sporting events, concerts or nightclubs.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Scotland had fourth hottest summer on record
item.description: The Met Office said it was unusual for the UK's highest August temperature to be recorded in Scotland.

item.title: SPFL: Neil Doncaster says vaccine passports will have 'significant consequences'
item.description: The Scottish government's plans to introduce vaccine passports for events will have "significant unintended consequences" for clubs, says SPFL chief executive Neil Doncaster.

item.title: Third Covid jab advised for most vulnerable 1%
item.description: More than 400,000 people in the UK are eligible - but plans for further boosters are yet to be confirmed.

item.title: Man dies and another injured in head-on crash in Borders
item.description: A van and lorry were involved in the collision on the Melrose bypass near Borders General Hospital.

item.title: Killer jailed for attacking stranger in Lockerbie pub toilet
item.description: Stefan McCormack attacked then stamped on Rafal Sieja in the Black Bull pub in Lockerbie.

item.title: Scotrail engineers vote for strike action after pay talks collapse
item.description: About 250 workers who maintain and repair trains backed strike action in a dispute over pay and conditions.

item.title: Judges urged to halt Vorlich North Sea oilfield
item.description: Greenpeace says permission should not have been granted for the Vorlich field, 150 miles east of Aberdeen.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: One in 20 pupils developed virus after contact
item.description: About 5% of school pupils who came into contact with a child with Covid went on to test positive themselves.

item.title: Shipyard turnaround is 'most challenging in UK'
item.description: The man tasked with sorting out the troubled Ferguson Marine says there is still a lot to do.

item.title: UK imported more than half its gas in first three months of 2021
item.description: The industry body for the North Sea says more investment in new oil and gas fields is needed.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Is the drive to get young people jabbed working?
item.description: Covid cases are rising sharply in young adults despite all over 16s being eligible for vaccination.

item.title: Covid jab response low for some immunosuppressed people
item.description: Some high risk patients had few or no infection-fighting antibodies in their blood, a vaccine study found.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What are the rules?
item.description: Scotland's levels system of restrictions have come to an end - but what does that mean people can do?

item.title: Covid: How will Scotland's vaccine certificate change?
item.description: Scotland is launching a QR code system in line with similar "passports" rolled out across Europe.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Your questions answered on life after level zero
item.description: Readers have been sending in their questions about what the ending of more Covid rules means for them.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Are young people slowing the vaccine drive?
item.description: Concerns have been raised about vaccine uptake among younger adults, but are they less likely to want a jab? Here, we examine the statistics.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Pair complete UK's longest straight-line challenge
item.description: Calum Maclean and Jenny Graham climbed mountains, scrambled down gullies and tackled steep rocky crags on the route.

item.title: Edinburgh festivals: No fireworks but many are just happy it happened
item.description: Many are just happy that this year's Edinburgh festivals happened at all.

item.title: Glasgow 'fix room' campaigner went back to drugs after 11 years
item.description: Peter Krykant, who operated a drugs consumption van in Glasgow, says he found it hard to get help in Scotland.

item.title: Rankin 'honoured' to complete McIlvanney novel
item.description: Ian Rankin finished a draft manuscript written by the acclaimed crime writer William McIlvanney who died in 2015.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: When do school pupils have to self-isolate?
item.description: With the virus surging, we re-examine the new isolation rules and ask whether schools can ask pupils to stay at home.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon says SNP-Green deal is 'a leap of faith'
item.description: Scottish Greens co-leaders Patrick Harvie and Lorna Slater are joining Nicola Sturgeon's government.

item.title: Greta Thunberg: 'I'll go to COP26 if it's safe and democratic'
item.description: Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg says she does not think November's COP26 summit in Glasgow will lead to "much results".

item.title: Fire crews tackle Nick Nairn restaurant blaze
item.description: Fire crews battle to tackle a blaze at Nick Nairn's restaurant in Bridge of Allan.

item.title: The tiny island school that needs a new teacher
item.description: A small school on a remote Scottish island is in the market for a new teacher.

item.title: Footage shows fire damage to Edinburgh 'Harry Potter' cafe
item.description: An early morning blaze caused fire, smoke and water damage to a cafe made famous by Harry Potter author JK Rowling.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Wheelchair racer Sammi Kinghorn wins bronze
item.description: Scottish wheelchair racer Sami Kinghorn vowed "one day I will win gold" after earning her first Paralympic medal with bronze in the T53 100m.

item.title: Kim Little: Scotland midfielder retires from international football at age 31
item.description: Midfielder Kim Little has been hailed as one of Scotland's best-ever players after announcing her retirement from international football.

item.title: Josh Taylor: Undisputed world champion to face Jack Catterall in Glasgow
item.description: Undisputed world champion Josh Taylor is relishing a Scottish homecoming fight in front of a full house after his "tainted" triumph over Jose Ramirez in Las Vegas.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Gordon Reid and Alfie Hewett reach semi-finals
item.description: Defending champion Gordon Reid and Rio silver medallist Alfie Hewett both made it into to the men's singles semi-finals.

item.title: Servette Women 1-1 Glasgow City: Clare Shine goal maintains Champions League hopes
item.description: Glasgow City's hopes of reaching the Women's Champions League group stages are very much alive after a battling draw against Servette in Geneva.
